inn1.comm: Masakadza starts things off to Smith, slip in place and four in the ring saving one on the off side, none of them matter here though, as it's outside off stump and left alone
touch of swing, decent pace, line awry as it head down for a leg-side wide
very correct straight delivery meets an even more correct straight bat, good cricket
good start from Masakadza, this again is a good length and line, Smith gets his broad bat in the way to pat back to the bowler
oops, the line is wrong again this time, only by a fraction, but a inch means a mile down the leg side in ODI cricket
thickish inside edge found, skewing the ball into the leg side for a single
hint of swing here, and an excellent full length, hurries Amla into a weary defensive prod
good first over ends with another away swinger that is steered to point
Nicolson is in just his second ODI here and starts it with a shortish ball that surprises Smith by bouncing a fraction more than expected, guided into the leg side for a swift single
good ball again here, very chest-on action, but some extra bounce that Amla hops to defend

wow, here's a batsman in form, Nicolson slings down, with a rather round arm, a widish length ball, Amla flings his hands through it, sending the ball sailing over third man for a six! That's one way to get off the mark
good delivery here, outside off and Amla leaves alone
touch fuller, touch straighter and calmly defended
unlucky for Nicolson! Amla flashes again outside off and this time goes a finer edge that flew through a vacant first slip for four
hint of pace and bounce seems to surprise Smith as he looks to turn this around the corner
Masakadza's first really poor delivery and Smith took full advantage. It's a very simple rule of the game - Shot. Wide. Four.
much better, honing in to the top of off, with a hint of swing and even the mighty Smith can only defend
decent line again, perhaps a touch too straight, allows Smith to work towards midwicket
enough width here from Amla to flash his arms and wrists through this, pinging off the bat to deep point
decent end to the over, back of a length around off stump, Smith shuffles across to defend
there's something of a liability in the way Nicolson delivers, doesn't look the strongest of actions, but the line is good enough to keep Amla on strike
touch of extra bounce around off stump, Amla rises with it to defend
too short and despite some tennis-ball bounce, Amla swats this off his eyebrows for four down to fine leg
ooh dear, beamer! Probably not intentional but it flew through at neck-height, the bowler apologised straight away,  Amla worked it to third man
oh dear, the line is wrong here, down the leg side and Smith is gifted a help-yourself four
no ball this time, overstepping the mark which means free hit time, cripes, he was a long way over

in the slot and Smith does indeed grasp how much of a possibility was laid before 
him there, getting deep into his crease and clattering a pull shot into the stands over cow corner
oh dear, an over to forget, down the leg side again and Smith works off his hip to collect another boundary. South Africa are officially flying now
slower ball, and very well delivered too, out the back of the hand and defended, Amla called a swift single and Smith had to really scamper through
touch of width here and Smith picks out the short third man with his steer
well bowled, good length and line, Smith defends crisply towards point and jogs through a single
another slower ball, Masakadza is mixing it up well so far, crucially his line is good and Amla leans forward to defend
yet another slower delivery, Amla saw it, waited for it, paused, waited and upper-cut to the third man boundary, lovely batting
does he have a quicker ball!? Everything is out the back of the hand here, Amla flicks with typical grace and elan towards deep midwicket to take a single
what a lovely start! Hint of air, dips, does Smith in the flight as he tries to skip down the wicket, ends up getting leading-edge along the ground to the bowler
oh dear, too short, sits up like a naughty egg white, begging to be beaten, which Smith does, hammering through point

brilliant bowling! Wonderful stuff from Utseya! Draws Smith down the wicket with some flight, before dipping, going between bat and pad as Smith swings aimlessly past it and Taibu has the bails off in a flash. Marvellous piece of spin bowling!
Duminy down the track and forced to defend
once again there is nothing on offer for Duminy, can only defend
excellent over from Utseya, he's a real talent, ends with careful defence from Duminy
another Masakadza slower ball, Amla works into space for a single
this is a fuller-pace delivery, outside off stump, Duminy watchful early on, letting it go by
this is an even better delivery, tight on off stump Duminy reaches for the textbook and defends with the straightest of bats
just a hint of width, but Duminy knew what it meant, time for a square drive, and he played it stylishly for four through point
this time it's a touch shorter from Masakadza and Duminy works it to deep square
Masakadza strikes! This flew off a length, rearing up at Amla as he tried to run it down to third man, only managed a fine edge which Taibu snaffled gleefully
Duminy has strike to the new over and he starts by patting to midwicket for a single
mid-off is deep and de Villiers works it down there for one
good bowling here, nothing for Duminy to do but push to cover
somehow Duminy got two here, even though he drove firmly to long-off
again a touch a dip beats the batsman in the flight and Duminy has to defend
worked down the ground for a single to end an excellent over
Masakadza finds a very good length and line to begin with and defended
touch of extra bounce, there is a certain life in the track, Duminy stands tall and steers to deep point

de Villiers shuffles outside leg, then back in line, dandy mover that he is, singer too, but from what I heard he's pretty dreadful, his batting is good though, and this is driven very neatly to deep cover
very, very firmly driven, but straight to mid-off
bit of a false shot, perhaps it stuck in the wicket this time a fraction, Duminy ended up with a thickish outside edge into the off side
slipped down the leg side, Duminy flicks it away very nicely, beating short fine leg to collect four
cry of 'catch!' from the fielders as de Villiers chips one-bounce to long-on
poor delivery, too shot and Duminy stylishly drives through extra cover for four
follows the boundary with a stroked single down the ground
touch slower from Utseya and worked to leg
again de Villiers works to leg, picking out the fielder at short fine leg
calmly and carefully defended
starts with a back-of-a-length delivery that is worked around the corner for a single
Masakadza  is lucky to get away with this, dishes up some width that de Villiers slashes quickly but straight to point
width again, de Villiers happy to drive, ends up outside edging and it races down to third man
bouncer this time, Duminy is through his shot too quickly and ends up bottom-edging for a single to square leg
slower ball, and it really is slow, de Villiers waits and drives through cover
bouncer, but it was too short and heading down the leg side, Duminy ducked, but he could have done a star jump and still avoided it
nibbled off the body into the leg side
nicely delivered, saw Duminy advancing and threw it out wider, forced a defence
quicker this time, fired in flat and defended
carefully patted back to the bowler, good pressure building
just short enough for Duminy to get back and cut to deep point
de Villiers prods this very suspiciously back to Utseya
tidy over ends with a leg-wide work for a single
Nicholson is back and he starts well, full length, off stump,pushed to deep cover for one
good delivery again here, no room for Duminy to work with and he defends back to the bowler
touch shorter, the extra bounce means Duminy is unable to time his attempted steer
short again, down the leg side and Duminy works around the corner
piece of Test cricket here, goodish line and length from the bowler, left alone by the batsman
de Villiers aimed a slash outside off but doesn't connect
Duminy edges down the track but can't quite make a half-volley of it so milks a single down the ground
nicely played, skipped down the wicket and clipped down to long-on very firmly
touch too short but Utseya gets away with it as Duminy cuts to point
nothing for de Villiers to get hold of, on and around off stump and defended
down the wicket and again milked to long-on
close run as Duminy picks out point with a square cut and scampers a single
too much width dished up from Nicolson and Duminy drives handsomely to cover who slides and makes a mess of the save, gifting a single
outside off stump and left alone
very correct and compact defence, dropped towards point and de Villiers calls through a single
half-volley, sure, but Duminy puts this away in style, driving with the fullest of faces wide of mid-off for four, Nicolson screams at himself, as well he might
sprayed down the leg side and Duminy works it for a single
touch shorter, de Villiers gets deep into his crease, defends and steals a single
fired in flat and quick and defended
nothing here for de Villiers, defending compactly
a good diving stop to his right saves Utseya a single as de Villiers tries to push down the ground
this time de Villiers does get the single, skipping down the wicket pushing down to long-on to bring up the 100
good quality milking from Duminy, working the strike over
very delicate late cut attempted, and it goes off the bottom edge for one
up in the slot and de Villiers won't miss out there, punching a drive imperiously through cover for four
too short but the pull shot is mistimed, luckily for the bowler
oh dear, too short, too wide, de Villiers slashes hard to collect four and bring up the 50 stand
finally Nicolson finds a length and line and forces a defence
the bowling is a touch generous but de Villiers puts it away beautifully, punching a drive wide of mid-off for four
little bit short, de Villiers deep into his crease, dropping it to point and stealing a single to head into  the drinks break
good start for the new bowler, good length and line and defended
Dabengwa serves up a full toss but de Villiers doesn't take full toll, instead just bunting a single away
defended carefully
misfield here allows an extra run, oh, and it was Nicolson as well, he's having a tough day
pushed quietly out to long on
good over ends with defence
down the track and worked into the leg side
de Villiers clips very firmly but straight to a diving midwicket
once again midwicket dives well to field
excellent bowling, saw de Villiers coming and fired it in quicker and shorter
again he sees the batsman coming and slips it in quicker, excellent bowling
good opening over, nothing there for de Villiers
full and straight and defended
touch too much flight this time and Duminy is easily able to flick a single away
tickled around the corner for one
worked from around middle stump into a space at square leg for one
firmly punched down to long-off
tickled with the softest of hands into the leg side for one
worked into the leg side again for a strike-turner
de Villiers down the wicket, opening the face to pick a gap at cover with his drive
milked down the ground for a single
quicker ball, de Villiers gets back and defends
first time Cremer's line has strayed but the sweep finds deep square so just a single
Duminy tries to turn this to leg but can't quite get enough of it, good over again
driven down to long off
loud appeal for leg before, Duminy was looking to sweep and missed the ball outside off, but was struck outside the line
turned to short fine
driven without any timing to short extra cover
turns this one in front of square to get off strike
AB skips down the track and gets right to the pitch of this flighted delivery, but drives straight back to the bowler
this time JP is down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball, and lifts it high and over long-on for a big one
he is using his feet well here, shimmies down the pitch again, Cremer shortens the length, but is worked away through midwicket, 50 up for JP
flighted on the pads, Duminy calmly turns it to midwicket
what timing from AB! skips down the track and lifts this with ease over extra cover for another boundary
this one's a half tracker, and de Villiers gleefully pulls it over midwicket for four, horror over this for Cremer
turned behind square towards short fine for a single
this is all too easy, again AB uses his feet well, and lifts Dabengwa over long off for six
slower this time, worked to short fine
comes down the track, takes this on the full, and drives through midwicket
turned to midwicket for another single
speared into leg stump, de Villiers drives confidently to wide long  off
swept away behind square for yet another single
turned to short fine and the sharp single is on, JP had to dive in at the non-striker's but all is well
de Villiers shuffles across and works this ball on middle to midwicket, 50 up for him as well
flight from Cremer, Duminy gets forward and turns it to midwicket
quicker and flatter this time, he can't beat short fine
down the track is Duminy, but Cremer shortens the length and he can only pat it towards midwicket
this one goes straight on, again de Villiers gets across and punches down to long on
shortish outside off, de Villiers almost chops the cut onto his stumps
gentle good length delivery outside off, AB taps it and runs
straight on the stumps, and Duminy sends it racing through midwicket with the sweetest of flicks
short, sitting up outside off, says "hit me", and Duminy does, but straight to deep midwicket
AB walks down and drives this length ball down to long on
fuller on the stumps, Duminy drives, but bottom edges it to midwicket
and a rare miss from AB as he is beaten in the flight by Cremer, almost yorked himself as he skipped down the track
on the pads, worked away square
again on the pads, this time to the left-hander, worked away through midwicket
turning away from leg stump, but a bit short, he rocks back and punches it wide of long on
driven to long on, this is really too simple at the moment
and gets simpler, as AB skips down the track and lifts this flighted delivery high over long on for another six, terrific footwork
on the leg stump, is worked away square
short of a good length outside off, some bounce for Chibhabha, punched back to the bowler
this is poor bowling, really is, short, absolute half tracker, sits up, is so slow that AB has to adjust late, but lifts it over deep midwicket for a six
better line, driven to long off
fullish ball on the stumps, played down to long off
good length outside off, driven without fuss to long off for another single
short of a good length outside off, cut away to the sweeper
strays on the pads, turned square
angled away across Duminy, who stays in the crease and guides it to third man
fuller delivery, driven to long off for another run
short, angling away, ends up wide outside off, but JP can't beat point with the cut
flicked away to short fine leg, the man is on the edge of the circle, and the single is on
dropped short and on the leg stump, Duminy pulls it straight to short fine leg who makes a mess of a straight forward chance, what a miss!
worked away through midwicket
short again, this time just outside off, Duminy glides it to third man, plays it very late, at the last moment
fullish on the stumps, AB hits the stumps with the straightest of straight drives, the ricochet allows a single
angled across the left-hander, and that late glide to third man yields a single
driven back to the bowler
outside off stump, guided to point for a run
short and climbing outside off, climbed too much in fact, and AB with a tennis forehand through extra cover
outside off, steered away to third man
length ball on the stumps, AB stays in his crease and works it square off the back foot
wide outside off stump, would have been called one, but Duminy throws is bat at it and picks up a single to the man at sweeper cover
full outside off, AB is down on one knee and drives fiercely but straight to the man on the sweeper boundary
nicely played, skipping down the wicket and cracked through cover
worked into the leg side for a single
carefully defended towards cover
swished into the midwicket region for a single
de Villiers leans on this, sending it scurrying away for a single to long-on
worked towards midwicket to steal the strike
deft and delicate from Duminy, the alliteration sending out a single to third man
rolls the wrists on a cut shot and sends it away for one
so easy for Duminy, turning his hands over the ball to collect a couple to fine leg
touch too short, touch too wide but luckily for the bowler the cut shot finds point
an open face steers this to third man for a single
good length - resembling a yorker - but the leg-side line allows de Villiers to knock gently into the midwicket region and collect a single
nicely bowled again from Utseya, saw de Villiers coming down the track and fired it in quicker and flatter
boom! Utseya though long-on had a chance, but it cleared him by a distance to scatter the crowds
the boundary is followed up by a single worked into space
'Catch!' was the cry, but you wouldn't want to get in the way of this! Duminy absolutely drilled this back past the bowler for four
clipped into the leg side for another single, gives de Villiers a chance to tee off
well adjusted from the batsman, came down the wicket and Utseya flung it wider, de Villiers had to fetch it from outside off to pick two wide of long-on
angled towards the legs from around the wicket, Duminy nurdles to deep midwicket to take a couple
touch short and a touch wide, Duminy cracks a cut to deep third man. South Africa are in total control here, needless to say.

oops, not a particularly good piece of bowing, in fact, it was awful. With Taibu up to the stumps this is shoved miles down the leg side, leaving the keeper sprawling helplessly as it disappears for five wides
way outside off stumps this time and de Villiers has all the room to free his arms and take two to deep point
worked into space for a single
Duminy opens the face very late to send this down to third man for a single
de Villiers finishes the over by punching a very correct drive down the ground
shortish ball to kick things off after the break and the pull shot is equally lethargic, bottom-edging for a single
worked away for a single
de Villiers pokes this into the leg side and scampers off for one
delicately fiddled into the leg side to bring de Villiers on to strike
punch drive is fielded by the bowler, who keeps de Villiers waiting
100 for de Villiers! His 9th overall and second in a row! Acknowledges the applause with a word to the heavens and a broad smile after dinking a single to leg
driven out to long-off with the fullest of faces
poor old Nicolson, he's fluffed again. Leg-side delivery goes off the pads straight through him at short fine leg and runs away for four
touch of extra bounce outside off beats Duminy's cut and thuds into Taibu's chest, bobbling away for a single
swift fielding by Utseya at short midwicket saves a single
great shot this! That's gone miles! Just a fraction short and de Villiers unleashed a pull shot in a flash sending it a long, long way over the rope at deep midwicket
careful defence to finish the over but what damage these two have done 202 stand in 180 balls

Get the hard hats, it's raining cricket balls! Duminy this time has struck the cleanest of blows, skipping down the wicket and swinging a lofted drive beautifully for six. The Batting Powerplay hasn't even been taken yet
ooh dear, stumping chance missed, Duminy missed a leg-side fiddle and was out of his ground, Taibu missed a very tough chance
worked into space securely this time for one
wide of the off stump and bottom-edged for a single
too much width, gifting Duminy space to free his arms, crashing a boundary through point to bring him on to 99
100 for Duminy now! Good to see him back on form, works this to leg and affords himself a bright smile. Well played him
tickled round the corner for another single
Hamilton Masakadza into the attack, starts with some width outside off that is cracked square for one
straighter ball meets a very straight bat which is collected by the bowler
fiddled square of the wicket on the leg side for a single
Masakadza strikes! de Villiers falls trying to smash this over cow corner, didn't quite get hold of it and it ended up skewing off a top edge down to deep midwicket, who pouched a simple chance
Duminy had the strike but kindly offers it to his new partner by turning this round the corner for one
some width first up to the new man who drives comfortably to cover for one
good start from the bowler, touch of extra bounce clears the top edge of Morkel's attempted cut
more delicate shot offered from Morkel this time, just steering a single to short third-man
Duminy down the wicket meets this on the full but only bunts a single to midwicket
back of a length, Morkel deep into his crease and pushing to long-on for one
fuller and wide of leg stump, Duminy tickles around the corner but unluckily for him picks out short fine leg
driven carefully to long-off, good over from Utseya
slower ball full outside off, driven for a single
new ball please! Duminy has sent this one out the ground! Length ball in the slot outside off, Duminy leant back and clattered this over long-on
outside off stump, plenty of width but Duminy missed out, swinging at thin air
full toss finds a thickish outside edge that skews over cover for a couple
slower ball and Duminy didn't have any pace to work with so despite almost flinging himself off his feet with a pull shot, it only runs away for a single
leg-stump half volleys rarely end well for the bowler, and Morkel clipped it away very neatly to four
Utseya gets this all wrong, sending it a long way down the leg side to bring up 300, in unceremonious style
oh lovely shot, Duminy skips outside led and drives inside out, piercing the infield to beat cover for four
turned into the leg side for one
Morkel firmly drives to long-off for a single
crisp drive picks out point
this time it's worked to leg for one
bunted back to the bowler who fields. Poor Utseya, he's made to bowl at all the worst times
slower ball outside off stump, Duminy had plenty of width and tried to muller it through point, hard as he swished though, he only found thin air
another big swing of the arms, this time to a shorter slower ball, but Duminy picked out short fine leg
fullish length, outside off, Morkel meets it on the full and guides to point
good slower ball means Duminy again has no pace to work with, his expansive drive trickles to Utseya at cover who throws down the stumps but Duminy was home for a single
too full too wide, Morkel just needed to beat the infield with his cut, he duly did and collected four
up in the slot and asking for trouble, Morkel stood very still, eased his arms through the ball and slapped it over the bowler's head
good start, full, straight and jabbed back to the bowler
Nicolson's bad day gets worse, dishing this into the slot, Duminy leans back again and smashes it miles over long-on for six to bring up his career-best ODI score
tried to repeat the shot but was undone by a change in pace and it beat his outside edge
slower ball, up towards the yorker length, Duminy tries to get under it and smash down the ground but can't time it and it plops down safely
that'll be all. Duminy departs. Another massive leg-side mow attempted, got a top edge that went very high before coming down safely into the waiting hands of mid-off
fullish again from Nicolson and the drive finds cover
MIller pokes his first ball carefully to point
this is worked via a hint of bat and pad square of the wicket
very short, Morkel could have slapped this anywhere, as it was it came off the toe-end and ran away for four fine of third man
good delivery here, on a length and line and worked round the corner for one
pushed back to the bowler who fields smartly
touch short, and it kept low but Miller watched it carefully and cracked it to the square leg boundary
oh dear, that is a horrid delivery, shin-high full toss outside leg stump, Morkel can't do anything but swing it away for four
much, much better, straight and full and worked into the off side
with fine leg up in the circle, the pace not to bowl is leg stump, Nicolson sadly did and Miller helped himself to four
Nicolson finds a yorker and it's patted back to the bowler
the line is good here, even if the length was a tad overdone, clipped to midwicket for a single
driven with a hint of bad timing down the ground, because it wasn't firmly struck the batsmen entertained the idea of two, but it was only a single
poor ball, wrong line, outside leg stump and Morkel whipped a pull shot away past short fine leg for four
low full toss outside off is a much better idea, and Morkel can only toe-end down the ground for a single
another slower ball out the back of the hand, pushed into the off side for one
slower ball once more, but the length is good - yorker - and Morkel can't quite get the leverage to power this away, ends up toe-ending high to long-on who takes the chance
Miller bunts this to deep midwicket for a couple
shot! Flat six, clearing Taylor at long-off, really powerful shot
worked off the outside edge down to third man for a single
fuller ball squeezed out straight to point
good ball here, no pace to work with but good line and length and drilled to long-off
low full toss is crashed down the ground for a single
very wide of off stump
misfield here allows a single, crashed through the hands of cover
in the slot around leg stump, big inviting for Ingram who can't resist and swings this into the crowd over cow-corner
excellent batting, got a full toss but picked a gap between straight midwicket and wide long-on to collect four
much better bowling, yorker around off stump jabbed into the off side
full toss skews off the outside edge in the air and dropped at point running back
full toss again slapped hard down the ground for a single
shot! Ingram collects another boundary and 400 is on now! Length ball asking to be hit and it was crashed down the ground for six
fired in full and straight, squeezed to cover for a single
what do you know! Ingram's gone! Sliced straight to Cremer at cover who juggled the chance before grabbing hold to send Ingram on his way
Botha tries to swing his first ball into the leg side but doesn't connect and it thuds off his body for a single to bring Miller back on strike
good bowling, Miller gave himself room outside leg, so it was fired wide of off
slapped down the ground, just a couple so it would need a six off the final ball to bring up the 400
almost! Miller cracks a boundary very firmly down the ground, but can't get the elevation to clear the ropes. Nevertheless a mammoth score for Zimbabwe to chase

inn2.comm: starts off short of a good length on the stumps, played down into the onside
tapped into the covers and they scamper a couple
ooh, that took off from a good length outside off, Masakadza is surprised and fends it towards third man
this one takes off again, and Taylor watches it whizz past his bat, Morkel is generating some good bounce
short of a good length outside off, this time Taylor is right on top of it and punches it through the covers, and Amla chases in vain
in the zone outside off, moves away a shade after pitching, Taylor lets it go, good first over
gets it to move in off the seam from short of a good length, defended off the back foot
this one pitches outside off and goes on with the angle from over the wicket
again angled across the right-hander, Masakadza has a tentative poke at it
that angle across him lures him into the expansive drive outside off, it flies over gully to third man, that could have gone anywhere

Taylor is gone, and Tsotsobe has struck in his first over! it was short and climbing just outside off, Taylor looked to go over third man with the late upper cut, but does not get enough distance on the shot and it settles in to the hands of Theron at third man, who takes it on the boundary edge, good well-judged catch
left alone outside off stump
short of a good length outside off, he dabs it and takes off for a non-existent run, and had the fielder running in from point picked it up cleanly, he would have struggled
defends this shortish ball outside off watchfully
straightens after pitching short of a good length outside off, Chibhabha is opened up a bit as he defends
and again, he is getting it to straighten after pitching and it is bothering Chibhabha
short and wide outside off, Chibhabha unleashes a ferocious cut which flies to JP Duminy at point, who gets a hand to it, but that was struck too hard
driven to long-on
coming in after pitching, off the inside edge towards fine leg
and this one goes straight on, Chibhabha comes down the track, and it whizzes past his outside edge, no clue what he was up to there
bit of inward movement off the seam, but from outside off, and left alone
and again the one that goes straight on with the angle, past a nervous poke from Chibhabha, brilliant bowling
short, wide and rising outside off, Chibhabha throws everything at it, i mean everything, he is in the air as he slaps it over cover for a six
he walks down the track again to a delivery angling across him, and then lets it go at the last moment, queer approach
and another one goes! dug in short outside off, Masakadza is in no position to play the pull, but still goes ahead with the shot, and it goes straight to Rusty at mid on, Zimbabwe are struggling here
and almost plays on first ball! it was fullish outside off, he drove at it without footwork, and the inside edge goes past the stumps towards fine leg
better judgement from Taibu this time as he leaves this one on a good length outside off
angled in to the pads, Taibu is beaten for pace and is late on the attempted dab into the on side
short and wide outside off, Taibu cuts it and gets it between slip and gully for four
short of a good length outside off, left alone
angled across the batsman from short of a good length, he gets across and defends
fullish delivery on the stumps, dug out back to the bowler
gets across and works this shortish delivery towards midwicket
angled across Taibu, who lets it go, South Africa are all over Zimbabwe at the moment
good length outside off, driven straight to cover
short and quick outside off, Taibu is beaten on the cut by the generous bounce
pushes this length delivery through the covers for a couple
dropped or rather Morkel saved himself from some serious damage, as this one was slammed back straight at him, he just about got a hand to it as it sped to the boundary
this time he hits another full delivery straight to mid off, and a diving Amla there makes no mistake with a tumbling catch, and one more batsman perishes
short and into the body, fended away fine for a couple
angled across Ervine, who shoulders arms
dug short in to the body, defended with some discomfort down the track
short and angling away across the batsman, but miles outside off, and is rightfully called a wide
this one is much closer to the stumps, Taibu leaves it alone
short and wide, cut away in the air but falls well short of third man who misfields but no harm done
good length outside off, defended off the front foot towards point
fullish on the stumps, played back to the bowler
slower this time, coming in a shade after pitching outside off, he plays outside the line and is hit on the body
angling across Taibu who drives crisply but straight to short cover
angled across the left-hander who leaves it alone
short of a good length outside off, he gets right on top of the bounce and gets it into the gap at cover and it runs away for a boundary
which makes no difference, as he again punches through the same gap at cover for another boundary
Morkel produces the outside edge from a length delivery outside off, but it flies between the keeper and the slip for the third four of the over
back of a length this time, and climbing into Ervine, and defended into the onside
has a waft outside off to a wide delivery, is lucky there was no outside edge
Taibu the pint-sized dynamo, crashes this wide delivery outside off for a boundary through the covers
shortish ball into the body, defended down the track
goes for the cut shot again outside off, but can't beat the infield
and again, cuts it hard into the ground, but a diving Duminy prevents the boundary
there's no stopping this one, as it is disdainfully pulled through midwicket, disdainful and imperious
better length this time outside off, Taibu defends off the front foot
gentle back of a length delivery outside off, cut away to point
what a delivery! in the zone outside off, angling away from a good length, he has a lame poke and is beaten
on the stumps this time, played back down the track
gets room this time outside off, but can't beat one of the two men at point
guides this one to the right of the man at backward point, who runs across and dives but the single is on
quick, short and climbing into Taibu who stays back and plays it down towards square leg for a single, deft work from the little man
angling across the batsman, Parnell produces the edge which flies towards slip, but there is no one there and it goes all the way for a boundary
again Taibu with the cut, but there 's no timing in the shot
taps this one into the off side and runs, direct hit and Ervine was struggling
angled into Ervine, who is hit high on the pads
and again he can't work it away with the angle through midwicket, down the track to the bowler
fullish outside off this time, driven towards point
Rusty with the slower one outside off, Taibu runs it down through the vacant slip area for a single, wonder why there's no one at slip, sin't 399 enough runs?
in the corridor outside off, and Ervine had no clue about that apart from having a tame poke, and is beaten
drives this one nicely through the covers but there's a man on the sweeper fence
widish outside off, easily guided to third man
play and a miss outside off, Ervine has hit some good drives through the off side, but he's also been beaten numerous times
is surprised a bit by the bounce on this one outside off stump, plays it towards third man in the end
good length outside off, driven a bit airily towards third man off the outside edge
Parnell with that whippy action with a length delivery on the stumps, and Taibu defends down the track
drives towards midwicket this time for a quick single, a busy player is Tatenda Taibu
uff! nasty short delivery, Ervine is looking to get on the front foot and is surprised by the bouncer, and just about ducks under it
widish outside off this time, cut away down to third man
short on the leg stump, Taibu pulls it just over square leg and it runs away for four
one more glide down to third man, quite a few runs have come in that area
this time Taibu with the guide down to third man, ho hum
back of a length outside off, and guided away down to the man at ... third man
this time it is mid on who is in business, as Taibu pushes this length delivery towards him and takes a single
good line very close to the off stump, he defends cautiously towards the covers
the slower ball to finish the over, Ervine was already forward and adjusts to push it out towards point

what a start! Done him all ends up. Taibu played all round a straightish ball and it went through the gate. Every batsman knows the horror that lies through the gate and Botha is delighted as it rattles the stumps
nicely bowled again, Botha really tossing it up, which is unlike him
massive, pleading appeal from Botha, the umpire is utterly unmoved, but it looked close, pitching in line, hitting in line, but probably going over the top
lovely piece of fielding by Smith at point, he then flings the ball at Botha in his excitement and it cracks Botha on the knee. Ouch!
tossed up again and Ervine defends uneasily

bowled him! Through the dreaded gate again! Pitched and zipped off the track, Ervine was playing across it and it clipped the top of off stump. Botha tries to to leap to celebrate but his knee is still hurting and he ends up collapsed in a heap. Smith can't hold back his laughter!
Rusty rattles the stumps this time! Zimbabwe collapsing! Nothing delivery, just back of a length outside off stump but a tame push finds the inside edge and it goes on to the stumps!
touch of extra bounce for the carrot-topped Theron, Utseya seems much taller when he bats and rises to defend
good, accurate stuff from Theron, plenty of chat from those erudite South African fielders as Utseya defends in a hurry
fired in on a full length and straight line, what more could you ask, Utseya would probably want some width but there is nothing for him
the bliss of an inside edge gets Utseya off the mark, how many runs have come from inside-edges in this history of the game? First right answer wins my job
a very correct no-nonsense delivery meets an even more conventional forward defence. For all three of you following in England - this is Ronseal cricket
Botha is being treated with complete suspicion now after his opening over, and Dabengwa stretches forward to squeeze an inside-edge into the leg side for one
Utseya is full of tricks, with ball or bat, and here flips this nonchalantly over the keeper for three
no fancy-pants stuff from Dabengwa, just a simple bunt down  the ground for one
poor shot, flat-footed poke, didn't deserve to connect, and luckily for the batsman he didn't
goldenboy Miller made a right boo-boo here, stopping a regulation push at point before flinging it miles over the keeper to gift a single
dinked into the leg side for one
Dabengwa should be in a cosmetics advert judging by this, dropping a defensive push into the off side with the softest of hands to collect one
Utseya watches and watches and defends, playing the ball right under his eyes
very simple cricket from Utseya, allowing ball to hit bat and steering a single backwards of point
wow, Rusty finds some extra bounce here, kicking off a length to find the shoulder of the bat and sail towards third man on the bounce
slower ball this time, rolled out like a James Tredwell offspinner (not really spinning) and edged just short of a diving slip, who fails to collect cleanly
good length and line meets an equally impressive defence block
Dabengwa looks like a thoroughly organised young man, which is bad for nights at a pub but good for batting, clipping neatly into the leg side, he'd make a good bureaucrat
very steadily defended back to the bowler
another massive appeal from Botha, he does enjoy the sound of his own wail, not sure the umpire does though
fuller and quicker this time, Utseya jabs a bat down in time
very straight from Botha and worked to short midwicket
ah, the staple of so many middle-over ODI shots, the milk down the ground for one
good delivery from Parnell, bolt upright seam on a yorker that's jabbed to midwicket
very elegant drive, deserved more than it's one
Dabengwa forward confidently and driving confidently, can only find a fielder
Parnell strikes! Top bowling! Fired in full and straight, Dabengwa over-balanced as he tried to flick to leg, ended up in an ugly heap as he was trapped in front
Parnell gives Cremer a sighter first up, which is nice of him
once again it's outside off stump and Cremer leaves alone
Utseya won't want to get out to a rival spinner and emphasises this point with resolute defence
wee bit short from Botha, Utseya senses a chance to get one-up in the spinner war and wheels away a pull shot
Cremer is another spinner, so all spin out there, which is exactly how the game should be, careful defence
wonderfully elegant defence from the legspinner
another watchful skilful block
oops, hint of leading edge as Cremer - a legspinner let's not forget - tries to turn this into the leg side
Parnell has been good this spell - I say spell, it's only been 7 balls, but they've been good
he promptly ruins it by bowling a filthy half-tracker, Utseya doesn't got more than a glove on it and it bobbles away for one
ooh, beaten outside off, Cremer leant forward into a languid defence, but the ball zipped past the edge
dug in a bit short, Cremer aims the most hideous swipe down the ground and gets barely a toe-end on it
this time it's pushed more calmly into the leg side
good line from Parnell, good length too, Utseya is forever busy and bustling, full of beans and prods a defence before scampering through for one
a very straight ball meets a very straight bat
quicker and flatter, the sort of ugly Botha delivery that should only be a variation
ah, much nicer, thrown up outside off drawing a defensive prod
good flight  and some extra bounce too makes Utseya's defence uneasy
good take from de Villiers, always enjoyable to see a leg-side take standing up to the stumps
bit of bounce again, Utseya gets deep into his crease, stands on his toes and punches down to long-on
Cremer has taken some ugly smiting when bowling and he gets a chance to repay the favour here, toe-ending unspectacularly to deep point
pushed firmly and crisply to cover
Parnell pitches full and offers tantalising width which Cremer uses to free his arms, crashing to cover
chirpy, that's what South Africa are at the moment, very chirpy, epitomised by Duminy's diving stop
"the end is nigh," cries the commentator without a hint of hyperbole, Cremer gets a short ball but the attempted pull finds a top edge that loops gently into the hands of Amla. Good work from Parnell
good wheels from Parnell, he's really racing in, lands a shortish ball that rears up on Utseya, who works it around the corner for one
should I leave, should I play? Who knows? Masakadza certainly doesn't, he does neither and is lucky to get away with it
the most resolute of defence
once again Utseya is giving nothing away
nibbled off the inside edge, again that marvellous inside edge, for a single towards midwicket
Masakadza winds up as he's about to thwack this a mile, instead defends carefully
big backlift offers a tidy pat back to the bowler
squeezed away off the inside half of the bat
steered to point who for some reason spills a routine stop
very correctly worked to mid-off
there is a lot to like about this Parnell spell, this is the best he's been all series, quick and with the angle across the right-hander beating the outside edge
oh rats, after all that praise he bangs in a long-hop, Utseya is too good to miss out and thumps a boundary to deep square
fuller, straighter, blocked. What  more can I say?
beaten again, good stuff from Parnell, slipping this past the outside edge, he deserves to finish this off quickly
Botha has settled on a lovely length and line and Masakadza can do nothing but block
you have to admire Masakadza's discipline, giving nothing away here
careful, pub-denying defence from Masakadza
bosh! 'Av it! Bit of air from Botha, and for once Masakadza unwinds his big backlift to send this over mid-on for six
back to careful defence
wow! Get this guy up the order! Botha drops just a fraction short and Masakadza clatters it miles over midwicket
Duminy hits the stumps! But only with his body as he tried to slide in and under-arm flick the ball, made a hash of the throw but he cleaned up the stumps with his body
steered to third man for a single
Theron strikes! Middle stump out the ground! Theron aims a yorker, and lands it perfectly, clipping the boot and ricochetting on to middle
big appeal from the fielder, nothing from the bowler, who clearly has a firmer grasp of the rules because it came off the inside edge
classic No. 11 drive, plenty of loose movements and surprise that ball hit bat
that'll be all! Theron finds some extra bounce, Nicolson ends a miserable day be gloving behind and South Africa have recorded their biggest ODI win
